title: Is admitting defeat a sign of strength? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, if its true. Not if its not true. You should never accept someone’s word that you are defeated if you are not. You do not have to be a doormat. But if you really were defeated it is only in acknowledging the truth that you can move on with your integrity intact. Also, when you are honest with yourself you have a chance of improving with no sense of guilt. It is better for goodwill between you and whoever defeated you as well. They also might be more prepared to give you some good tips for the future, and you might become good friends or partners in whatever the activity concerned was. If you are put in a position where someone else says you were defeated but you were not, then you either walk away or find a non-confronting way to point out that you were not — like “That may be your perception, but it is not mine”. But the main point is that if you are defeated then the only realistic thing is to admit it. Have a laugh at yourself. It lightens everyone’s mood.

Yes it is a sign of strength by accepting you allow yourself to overcome humiliation, fear and broaden you point of view that will shape your maturity in life. People who deny defeat are the type of person who are slave of fear and ignorancy. People who recognize their defeat are deep minded and emotionally resilience person.
